info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Stephens, northeastern Habersham, Rabun, southeastern Macon, southwestern Transylvania, Jackson, southwestern Haywood, western Pickens and Oconee Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Sylva to 14 miles southeast of Franklin to 6 miles northwest of Clayton. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seneca, Walhalla, Clayton, Sylva, Clemson, Toccoa, Cullowhee, Westminster, Highlands and Mountain City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
